label: ZMNHHD
info_overview: Mini Dimmer is a MOSFET-switching light device that also supports control of low-voltage halogen lamps with electronic transformers, dimmable compact fluorescent lights, and dimmable LED bulbs. It measures power consumption of the connected device. It supports push-button/momentary switches (default) and toggle switches. It can work with or without the neutral line. Qubino Mini Dimmer allows the easiest and quickest installation. It is designed to be mounted inside a “flush mounting box”, hidden behind a traditional wall switch. It acts as repeater in order to improve range and stability of Z-Wave network.
info_inclusion:
Inclusion

AUTOMATICALLY ADDING THE DEVICE TO A Z-WAVE NETWORK (AUTO INCLUSION)

  1. Enable add/remove mode on your Z-Wave gateway (hub)
  2. Automatic selection of secure/unsecure inclusion.
  3. The device can be automatically added to a Z-Wave network during the first 2 minutes
  4. Connect the device to the power supply
  5. Auto-inclusion will be initiated within 5 seconds of connection to the power supply and the device will automatically enrol in your network. 

(when the device is excluded and connected to the power supply it automatically eneters the LEARN MODE state.)

NOTE: LEARN MODE state allows the device to receive network infromation from the controller

NOTE: Please wait at least 30 seconds between each inclusion and exclusion.

MANUALLY ADDING THE DEVICE TO A Z-WAVE NETWORK (MANUAL INCLUSION)

  1. Connect the device to the power supply
  2. Enable add/remove mode on your Z-Wave gateway (hub)
  3. Toggle the switch connected to the I1 terminal 3 times within 3 seconds (this procedure put the device in LEARN MODE)

OR

Press and hold the S (Service) button between 2 and 6 seconds if connected to 24-30VDC (this procedure put the device in LEARN MODE)

4. A new device will appear on your dashboard

NOTE: LEARN MODE state allows the device to receive network infromation from the conttoller 

NOTE: Please wait at least 30 seconds between each inclusion and exclusion.

Mini Dimmer supports the latest Security 2 feature. When adding the Mini Dimmer to a Z-Wave network with a controller supporting Security 2 (S2), the PIN code of the Z-Wave Device Specific Key (DSK) is required. The unique DSK code is printed on the product label and a copy is inserted in the packaging, which must not be lost. Do not remove the DSK from the product. As a backup measure, use the label in the packaging. The first five digits of the key are highlighted or underlined to help the user identify the PIN code portion of the DSK text.
info_exclusion:
Exclusion

REMOVAL FROM A Z-WAVE NETWORK (Z-WAVE EXCLUSION)

  1. Connect the device to the power supply
  2. Make sure the device is within direct range of your Z-Wave gateway (hub) or use a hand-held Z-Wave remote to perform exclusion
  3. Enable add/remove mode on your Z-Wave gateway (hub)
  4. Toggle the switch connected to the I1 terminal 3 times within 3 seconds (this procedure put the device in LEARN MODE)

OR

Press and hold the S (Service) button between 2 and 6 seconds if connected to 24-30VDC (this procedure put the device in LEARN MODE)

  1. The device will be removed from your network, but any custom configuration parameters will not be erased

NOTE: LEARN MODE state allows the device to receive network infromation from the conttoller 

NOTE: Please wait at least 30 seconds between each inclusion and exclusion.

          If Load is ON, you can schedule it to turn OFF automatically after a period of time defined\u00a0in this parameter.           <\/p>

          Values:
          \u2022 default value 0
          \u2022 0 - Auto OFF Disabled
          \u2022 1 - 32536 = 1 - 32536 seconds - Auto OFF timer enabled for a given amount of seconds <\/p>", "size": 2, "bitmask": "00000000", "default": 0, "read_only": false, "write_only": false, "value_min": 0, "value_max": 32536, "options": [] }, { "id": 12, "label": "Turn Load 1 On Automatically with Timer", "description": "Turn Load 1 On Automatically with Timer", "overview": "

          If Load is OFF, you can schedule it to turn ON automatically after a period of time defined\u00a0in this parameter. The timer is reset to zero each time the device receives an OFF or ON command, either remotely (from the gateway (hub) or associated device) or locally from the switch.<\/p>


          Values:
          \u2022 default value 0
          \u2022 0 - Auto ON Disabled
          \u2022 1 - 32536 = 1 - 32536 seconds - Auto ON timer enabled for a given amount of seconds<\/p>", "size": 2, "bitmask": "00000000", "default": 0, "read_only": false, "write_only": false, "value_min": 0, "value_max": 32536, "options": [] }, { "id": 21, "label": "Enable\/Disable the Double click function", "description": "Enable\/Disable the Double click function", "overview": "

          If the Double click function is enabled, a fast double click on the push-button will set the dimming level to the maximum dimming value.<\/p>


          Values:
          \u2022 default value 0
          \u2022 0 - double click disabled
          \u2022 1 - double click enabled <\/p>", "size": 1, "bitmask": "00000000", "default": 0, "read_only": false, "write_only": false, "value_min": 0, "value_max": 1, "options": [ { "value": 0, "label": "Double click disabled" }, { "value": 1, "label": "Double click enabled" } ] }, { "id": 30, "label": "Restore on\/off status for load after power failure", "description": "Restore on\/off status for load after power failure", "overview": "

          This parameter determines if on\/off status is saved and restored for the load after power failure.<\/p>


          Values:
          \u2022 default value 0
          \u2022 0 - Device saves last on\/off status and restores it after a power failure.
          \u2022 1 - Device does not save on\/off status and does not restore it after a power failure, it remains off. <\/p>", "size": 1, "bitmask": "00000000", "default": 0, "read_only": false, "write_only": false, "value_min": 0, "value_max": 1, "options": [ { "value": 0, "label": "Save last on\/off status" }, { "value": 1, "label": "Don't save last on\/off status" } ] }, { "id": 40, "label": "Power Consumption Threshold", "description": "Power Consumption Threshold", "overview": "

          Watt Power Consumption Reporting Threshold for Load\u00a0\u00a0<\/p>

          Choose by how much the power consumption needs to increase or decrease to be reported.\u00a0Values correspond to percentages so if 10 is set (by default), the device will report any power consumption changes of 10% or more compared to the last reading.<\/p>


          Values (size is 1 byte dec):
          \u2022 default value 10
          \u2022 0 - Power consumption reporting disabled
          \u2022 1 - 100 = 1% - 100%<\/p>

          Power consumption reporting enabled. New value is reported only when Wattage in real time changes by more than the percentage value set in this parameter compared to the previous Wattage reading, starting at 1% (the lowest value possible).<\/p>

          NOTE: The power consumption needs to increase or decrease by at least 2 Watts to be reported, regardless of percentage set in this parameter.<\/strong><\/p>", "size": 1, "bitmask": "00000000", "default": 10, "read_only": false, "write_only": false, "value_min": 0, "value_max": 100, "options": [] }, { "id": 42, "label": "Power Consumption Threshold (time)", "description": "Power Consumption Threshold (time)", "overview": "

          Watt Power Consumption Reporting Time Threshold for Load\u00a0\u00a0<\/p>

          Set value refers to the time interval with which power consumption in Watts is reported (0 \u2013\u00a032767 seconds). If 300 is entered, energy consumption reports will be sent to the gateway (hub) every 300 seconds (or 5 minutes) if there was a change compared from the last report.<\/p>


          Values:
          \u2022 default value 0
          \u2022 0 - Power consumption reporting on time interval disabled
          \u2022 30 - 32767= 30 - 32767seconds. Power consumption reporting enabled. Report is sent according to time interval (value) set here.<\/p>


          NOTE: Values from 1 to 29 are ignored by device due to standard recommendation.<\/strong>
          NOTE: The report will be send only if there was a change compared to the last report<\/strong><\/p>", "size": 2, "bitmask": "00000000", "default": 0, "read_only": false, "write_only": false, "value_min": 0, "value_max": 32767, "options": [] }, { "id": 60, "label": "Minimum dimming value", "description": "Minimum dimming value", "overview": "

          The value set in this parameter determines the minimum dimming value (the lowest value which can be set on the device, when, for example, dimming lights with wall switch or slider in the GUI (Gateway - hub)).<\/p>

          Values:
          \u2022 default value 0 = 0% (minimum dimming value)
          \u2022 0- 98 = 0% - 98%, step is 1%. Minimum dimming value is set by entering a value.<\/p>

          NOTE: The minimum level may not be higher than the maximum level!<\/strong><\/p>", "size": 1, "bitmask": "00000000", "default": 0, "read_only": false, "write_only": false, "value_min": 0, "value_max": 98, "options": [] }, { "id": 61, "label": "Maximum dimming value", "description": "Maximum dimming value", "overview": "

          The value set in this parameter determines the maximum dimming value (the highest value which\u00a0can be set on the device, when, for example, dimming lights with wall switch or slider in the GUI\u00a0(Gateway - hub))<\/p>

          Values:
          \u2022 default value 99 = 99% (Maximum dimming value)
          \u2022 1- 99 = 1% - 99%, step is 1%. Maximum dimming value is set by entering a value.<\/p>

          NOTE: The maximum level may not be lower than the minimum level!<\/strong><\/p>", "size": 1, "bitmask": "00000000", "default": 1, "read_only": false, "write_only": false, "value_min": 1, "value_max": 99, "options": [] }, { "id": 65, "label": "Dimming time when key pressed", "description": "Dimming time when key pressed", "overview": "

          Choose the time during which the device will move between the min. and max. dimming values\u00a0by a short press of the push-button I1.
          <\/p>

          Values:
          \u2022 default value 1 = 1s
          \u2022 1 - 127 = 1 seconds- 127 seconds, step is 1 second <\/p>", "size": 1, "bitmask": "00000000", "default": 1, "read_only": false, "write_only": false, "value_min": 1, "value_max": 127, "options": [] }, { "id": 66, "label": "Dimming time when key hold", "description": "Dimming time when key hold", "overview": "

          Choose the time during which the Dimmer will move between the min. and max. dimming values\u00a0during a continuous press of the push-button I1, by an associated device or through the UI\u00a0controls (BasicSet, SwitchMultilevelSet).
          <\/p>

          Values:
          \u2022 default value 3 = 3s
          \u2022 1-127 = 1 second \u2013 127 seconds
          \u2022 128 \u2013 253 = 1 minute \u2013 126 minutes <\/p>", "size": 2, "bitmask": "00000000", "default": 3, "read_only": false, "write_only": false, "value_min": 1, "value_max": 127, "options": [] }, { "id": 67, "label": "Ignore start level", "description": "Ignore start level", "overview": "

          Choose whether the device should use (or disregard) the start dimming level value. If the device\u00a0is configured to use the start level, it should start the dimming process from the currently set\u00a0dimming level. This parameter is used with association group 3.<\/p>

          Values:
          \u2022 default value 0
          \u2022 0 \u2013 use the start level value
          \u2022 1 - ignore the start level value<\/p>

          NOTE: Parameter is valid only in Dimmer mode. In Switch mode the parameter has no effect.<\/strong><\/p>", "size": 1, "bitmask": "00000000", "default": 0, "read_only": false, "write_only": false, "value_min": 0, "value_max": 1, "options": [ { "value": 0, "label": "use the start level value" }, { "value": 1, "label": "ignore the start level value" } ] }, { "id": 68, "label": "Dimming duration", "description": "Dimming duration", "overview": "

          Choose the time during which the device will transition from the current value to the new target\u00a0value. This parameter applies to the association group 3.<\/p>


          Values:
          \u2022 default value 0 (dimming duration according to parameter 66)
          \u2022 1 - 127 (from 1 to 127 seconds)<\/p>

          NOTE: Parameter is valid only in Dimmer mode. In Switch mode the parameter has no effect.<\/strong><\/p>", "size": 1, "bitmask": "00000000", "default": 0, "read_only": false, "write_only": false, "value_min": 0, "value_max": 127, "options": [] }, { "id": 70, "label": "Overload safety switch", "description": "Overload safety switch", "overview": "

          The function allows for turning off the controlled device in case of exceeding the defined power\u00a0for more than 5s. Controlled device can be turned back on by input I1 or sending a control\u00a0frame.<\/p>


          Values:
          \u2022 default value 200
          \u2022 1 \u2013 200 = 1 W \u2013 200W
          \u2022 0 = function not active<\/p>

          NOTE: This functionality is not an overload safety protection, please check the technical specifications chapter for more details.<\/strong><\/p>

          In case of overload the following message will be send towards the controller:
          \u2022 COMMAND_CLASS_NOTIFICATION_V5
          \u2022 The Alarm V1 type field set to 0x00
          \u2022 Notification Type 0x08 and 0x08 (Overload detected)<\/p>", "size": 2, "bitmask": "00000000", "default": 200, "read_only": false, "write_only": false, "value_min": 1, "value_max": 200, "options": [] }, { "id": 71, "label": " Calibration trigger", "description": " Calibration trigger", "overview": "

          Choose when will be the calibration procedure triggered.<\/p>


          Values:
          \u2022 default value 0 - calibration done after power cycle if module is excluded
          \u2022 1 \u2013 calibration done after power cycle regardless of inclusion status
          \u2022 2 \u2013 force calibration. Calibration will start immediately <\/p>", "size": 1, "bitmask": "00000000", "default": 1, "read_only": false, "write_only": false, "value_min": 0, "value_max": 2, "options": [ { "value": 0, "label": "calibration after exclusion" }, { "value": 1, "label": "calibration after power cycle" }, { "value": 2, "label": "force calibration" } ] }, { "id": 72, "label": "Calibration status (read only)", "description": "Calibration status (read only)", "overview": "

          Whit this parameter you can check the calibration status.<\/p>


          Values:
          \u2022 default value 2 \u2013 calibration failed
          \u2022 1 \u2013 calibration was successful
          \u2022 2 \u2013 calibration failed <\/p>", "size": 1, "bitmask": "00000000", "default": 2, "read_only": true, "write_only": false, "value_min": 1, "value_max": 2, "options": [ { "value": 1, "label": "calibration was successful" }, { "value": 2, "label": "calibration failed" } ] }, { "id": 73, "label": "Alarm\/Notification events", "description": "Alarm\/Notification events", "overview": "

          This parameter defines the module behaviour in case it receives any Alarm\/Notification events.<\/p>


          Values:
          \u2022 default value 0 \u2013 function not active
          \u2022 1 \u2013 turn OFF
          \u2022 2 \u2013 turn ON
          \u2022 3 \u2013 start blinking (output turns 1s ON, and 1s OFF)<\/p>


          NOTE: When value 3 is selected the default time interval of the blinking is 10 minutes. It can be stopped with a button press or sending a control frame. To adjust the time interval please refer to parameter 74 \u2013 Alarm\/Notification time interval.<\/strong><\/p>", "size": 1, "bitmask": "00000000", "default": 0, "read_only": false, "write_only": false, "value_min": 0, "value_max": 3, "options": [] }, { "id": 74, "label": "Alarm\/Notification time interval", "description": "Alarm\/Notification time interval", "overview": "

          Alarm\/Notification time interval (dependant on parameter 73)<\/p>


          This parameter defines the time interval of the blinking state, once the module receives an alarm\/notification event. Minimum step increase is 1 minute.<\/p>


          Values (size is 1 byte dec):
          \u2022 default value 10 = 10 minutes
          \u2022 1 \u2013 125 = 1 -125 minutes<\/p>


          NOTE: This parameter does not have any effect if parameter 73 is not set to value 3 <\/strong><\/p>", "size": 1, "bitmask": "00000000", "default": 10, "read_only": false, "write_only": false, "value_min": 1, "value_max": 125, "options": [] } ], "associations": [ { "id": 1, "label": "Lifeline", "max_nodes": 1, "controller": true, "description": "Lifeline", "overview": "Supports the following command classes:<\/table>\r\n
          \u2022 Device Reset Locally: triggered upon request<\/table>\r\n
          \u2022 Meter Report: triggered according to Configuration parameters 40 and 42<\/table>\r\n
          \u2022 Notification Report: triggered on overload\/over temperature<\/table>\r\n
          \u2022 Switch Multilevel Report: triggered upon request or according to Configuration parameters 11 and 12 (note that this command class is active only in dimmer mode)<\/table>\r\n
          \u2022 Switch Binary Report: triggered upon request or according to Configuration parameters 11 and 12 (note that this command class is active only in switch mode)<\/table>\r\n

          \u00a0<\/p>" }, { "id": 2, "label": "Basic OnOff", "max_nodes": 16, "controller": false, "description": "Basic OnOff", "overview": "

          Supports the following command classes:<\/p>\r\n

          \u2022 Basic set: triggered at change of output and reflecting its state<\/p>" }, { "id": 3, "label": "StartStop level change", "max_nodes": 16, "controller": false, "description": "StartStop level change", "overview": "

          Supports the following command classes:<\/p>\r\n

          \u2022 Start\/Stop Level Change: triggered upon holding and releasing the switch connected to I1<\/p>\r\n

          \u00a0<\/p>\r\n

          NOTE: Association 3 StartStop level change is switch type dependant. The switch must be a\u00a0bi-stable switch type otherwise the association can not be trigered. To know how to change the switch type connected, please refer to chapter \"Configuration parameters\", in the official manual, for more information.<\/span><\/strong><\/p>\r\n

          NOTE: When the device is in switch mode (parameter 5 set to 1), this association group is<\/strong>\u00a0not available.\u00a0<\/span><\/strong>
          <\/span><\/p>" }, { "id": 4, "label": "Multilevel set", "max_nodes": 16, "controller": false, "description": "Multilevel set", "overview": "

          Supports the following command classes:<\/p>\r\n

          \u2022 Switch Multilevel Set: triggered at change of output and reflecting its state<\/p>\r\n

          \u00a0<\/p>\r\n

          NOTE: When the device is in switch mode (parameter 5 set to 1), this association group is<\/span>\u00a0not available.\u00a0<\/span><\/span><\/strong><\/p>" } ] }
category_description: Any device attached to the wall that controls a binary status of something, for ex. a light switch

parameters.label: In-wall Switch Type for Load to control I1
parameters.description: In-wall Switch Type for Load to control I1
parameters.overview:
With this parameter, you can select between push-button (momentary) and on/off toggle switch types. 

Values: 

• default value 0
• 0 - push-button (momentary)
• 1 - on/off toggle switch

parameters.label: Working mode
parameters.overview:
With this parameter, you can change the device presentation on the user interface.

Values:
• default value 0
• 0 - Dimmer mode
• 1 - Switch mode (works only in 3 way wiring-connection with neutral line)

NOTE: After parameter change, first exclude the device (without setting parameters to default value) then wait at least 30s before reinclusion.

parameters.label: Turn Load 1 Off Automatically with Timer
parameters.description: Turn Load 1 Off Automatically with Timer
parameters.overview:
If Load is ON, you can schedule it to turn OFF automatically after a period of time defined in this parameter. The timer is reset to zero each time the device receives an ON or OFF command, either remotely (from the gateway (hub) or associated device) or locally from the switch.

Values:
• default value 0
• 0 - Auto OFF Disabled
• 1 - 32536 = 1 - 32536 seconds - Auto OFF timer enabled for a given amount of seconds

parameters.label: Turn Load 1 On Automatically with Timer
parameters.description: Turn Load 1 On Automatically with Timer
parameters.overview:
If Load is OFF, you can schedule it to turn ON automatically after a period of time defined in this parameter. The timer is reset to zero each time the device receives an OFF or ON command, either remotely (from the gateway (hub) or associated device) or locally from the switch.


Values:
• default value 0
• 0 - Auto ON Disabled
• 1 - 32536 = 1 - 32536 seconds - Auto ON timer enabled for a given amount of seconds

parameters.label: Enable/Disable the Double click function
parameters.overview:
If the Double click function is enabled, a fast double click on the push-button will set the dimming level to the maximum dimming value.


Values:
• default value 0
• 0 - double click disabled
• 1 - double click enabled

parameters.label: Restore on/off status for load after power failure
parameters.description: Restore on/off status for load after power failure
parameters.overview:
This parameter determines if on/off status is saved and restored for the load after power failure.


Values:
• default value 0
• 0 - Device saves last on/off status and restores it after a power failure.
• 1 - Device does not save on/off status and does not restore it after a power failure, it remains off.

options.label: Save last on/off status
options.overview: Device saves last on/off status and restores it after a power failure.

options.label: Don't save last on/off status
options.overview: Device does not save on/off status and does not restore it after a power failure, it remains off.

parameters.label: Power Consumption Threshold
parameters.overview:
Watt Power Consumption Reporting Threshold for Load  

Choose by how much the power consumption needs to increase or decrease to be reported. Values correspond to percentages so if 10 is set (by default), the device will report any power consumption changes of 10% or more compared to the last reading.


Values (size is 1 byte dec):
• default value 10
• 0 - Power consumption reporting disabled
• 1 - 100 = 1% - 100%

Power consumption reporting enabled. New value is reported only when Wattage in real time changes by more than the percentage value set in this parameter compared to the previous Wattage reading, starting at 1% (the lowest value possible).

NOTE: The power consumption needs to increase or decrease by at least 2 Watts to be reported, regardless of percentage set in this parameter.

parameters.label: Power Consumption Threshold (time)
parameters.overview:
Watt Power Consumption Reporting Time Threshold for Load  

Set value refers to the time interval with which power consumption in Watts is reported (0 – 32767 seconds). If 300 is entered, energy consumption reports will be sent to the gateway (hub) every 300 seconds (or 5 minutes) if there was a change compared from the last report.


Values:
• default value 0
• 0 - Power consumption reporting on time interval disabled
• 30 - 32767= 30 - 32767seconds. Power consumption reporting enabled. Report is sent according to time interval (value) set here.


NOTE: Values from 1 to 29 are ignored by device due to standard recommendation.
NOTE: The report will be send only if there was a change compared to the last report

parameters.label: Minimum dimming value
parameters.overview:
The value set in this parameter determines the minimum dimming value (the lowest value which can be set on the device, when, for example, dimming lights with wall switch or slider in the GUI (Gateway - hub)).

Values:
• default value 0 = 0% (minimum dimming value)
• 0- 98 = 0% - 98%, step is 1%. Minimum dimming value is set by entering a value.

NOTE: The minimum level may not be higher than the maximum level!

parameters.label: Maximum dimming value
parameters.overview:
The value set in this parameter determines the maximum dimming value (the highest value which can be set on the device, when, for example, dimming lights with wall switch or slider in the GUI (Gateway - hub))

Values:
• default value 99 = 99% (Maximum dimming value)
• 1- 99 = 1% - 99%, step is 1%. Maximum dimming value is set by entering a value.

NOTE: The maximum level may not be lower than the minimum level!

parameters.label: Dimming time when key pressed
parameters.overview:
Choose the time during which the device will move between the min. and max. dimming values by a short press of the push-button I1.

Values:
• default value 1 = 1s
• 1 - 127 = 1 seconds- 127 seconds, step is 1 second

parameters.label: Dimming time when key hold
parameters.overview:
Choose the time during which the Dimmer will move between the min. and max. dimming values during a continuous press of the push-button I1, by an associated device or through the UI controls (BasicSet, SwitchMultilevelSet).

Values:
• default value 3 = 3s
• 1-127 = 1 second – 127 seconds
• 128 – 253 = 1 minute – 126 minutes

parameters.label: Ignore start level
parameters.overview:
Choose whether the device should use (or disregard) the start dimming level value. If the device is configured to use the start level, it should start the dimming process from the currently set dimming level. This parameter is used with association group 3.

Values:
• default value 0
• 0 – use the start level value
• 1 - ignore the start level value

NOTE: Parameter is valid only in Dimmer mode. In Switch mode the parameter has no effect.

parameters.label: Dimming duration
parameters.overview:
Choose the time during which the device will transition from the current value to the new target value. This parameter applies to the association group 3.


Values:
• default value 0 (dimming duration according to parameter 66)
• 1 - 127 (from 1 to 127 seconds)

NOTE: Parameter is valid only in Dimmer mode. In Switch mode the parameter has no effect.

parameters.label: Overload safety switch
parameters.overview:
The function allows for turning off the controlled device in case of exceeding the defined power for more than 5s. Controlled device can be turned back on by input I1 or sending a control frame.


Values:
• default value 200
• 1 – 200 = 1 W – 200W
• 0 = function not active

NOTE: This functionality is not an overload safety protection, please check the technical specifications chapter for more details.

In case of overload the following message will be send towards the controller:
• COMMAND_CLASS_NOTIFICATION_V5
• The Alarm V1 type field set to 0x00
• Notification Type 0x08 and 0x08 (Overload detected)

parameters.label: Calibration trigger
parameters.overview:
Choose when will be the calibration procedure triggered.


Values:
• default value 0 - calibration done after power cycle if module is excluded
• 1 – calibration done after power cycle regardless of inclusion status
• 2 – force calibration. Calibration will start immediately

options.label: calibration after exclusion
options.overview: calibration done after power cycle if module is excluded

options.label: calibration after power cycle
options.overview: calibration done after power cycle regardless of inclusion status

options.label: force calibration
options.overview: force calibration. Calibration will start immediately

parameters.label: Calibration status (read only)
parameters.overview:
Whit this parameter you can check the calibration status.


Values:
• default value 2 – calibration failed
• 1 – calibration was successful
• 2 – calibration failed

parameters.label: Alarm/Notification events
parameters.overview:
This parameter defines the module behaviour in case it receives any Alarm/Notification events.


Values:
• default value 0 – function not active
• 1 – turn OFF
• 2 – turn ON
• 3 – start blinking (output turns 1s ON, and 1s OFF)


NOTE: When value 3 is selected the default time interval of the blinking is 10 minutes. It can be stopped with a button press or sending a control frame. To adjust the time interval please refer to parameter 74 – Alarm/Notification time interval.

parameters.label: Alarm/Notification time interval
parameters.overview:
Alarm/Notification time interval (dependant on parameter 73)


This parameter defines the time interval of the blinking state, once the module receives an alarm/notification event. Minimum step increase is 1 minute.


Values (size is 1 byte dec):
• default value 10 = 10 minutes
• 1 – 125 = 1 -125 minutes


NOTE: This parameter does not have any effect if parameter 73 is not set to value 3

associations.label: Lifeline
associations.overview:
Supports the following command classes:
• Device Reset Locally: triggered upon request
• Meter Report: triggered according to Configuration parameters 40 and 42
• Notification Report: triggered on overload/over temperature
• Switch Multilevel Report: triggered upon request or according to Configuration parameters 11 and 12 (note that this command class is active only in dimmer mode)
• Switch Binary Report: triggered upon request or according to Configuration parameters 11 and 12 (note that this command class is active only in switch mode)

associations.label: Basic OnOff
associations.overview:
Supports the following command classes:

• Basic set: triggered at change of output and reflecting its state

associations.label: StartStop level change
associations.overview:
Supports the following command classes:

• Start/Stop Level Change: triggered upon holding and releasing the switch connected to I1

 

NOTE: Association 3 StartStop level change is switch type dependant. The switch must be a bi-stable switch type otherwise the association can not be trigered. To know how to change the switch type connected, please refer to chapter "Configuration parameters", in the official manual, for more information.

NOTE: When the device is in switch mode (parameter 5 set to 1), this association group is not available.

associations.label: Multilevel set
associations.overview:
Supports the following command classes:

• Switch Multilevel Set: triggered at change of output and reflecting its state

 

NOTE: When the device is in switch mode (parameter 5 set to 1), this association group is not available.

commandclass.name: NO_OPERATION
commandclass.label: No Operation - used for PINGing a device.
